intro: Verticordia laciniata, commonly known as the serrated leaf verticordia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its striking, often vividly colored flowers. The plant typically grows in heathland and sandplain habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually narrow and serrated, giving it its common name. It is a hardy species that thrives in full sun and is popular among native gardeners.
